statement.title: Content
statement.content:
We call two strings $S[1\cdots n]$ and $T[1\cdots n]$ similar if and only if:
1. They have the same length $n$.
2. For any pair of index $i$ and $j$, if $S\_i=S\_j$,then $T\_i=T\_j$.If $S\_i\neq S\_j$, then $T\_i\neq T\_j$ ($\neq$ means not equal to).

For example:
1. $S=$`AABBC` and $T=$`ZZYYK` are similar.
2. $S=$`AABBC` and $T=$`ZZYY` are not similar. (different length)
3. $S=$`AABBC` and $T=$`ZXYYK` are not similar. ($S\_1=S\_2$,$T\_1\neq T\_2$).

Now, give you two strings, please tell me whether they are similar.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content: The first line of input is a number $T$,indicating the number of test case.For each test case,there are two lines,string $S$ and string $T$.Each string only contains upper-case.English letters,at least $1$ letter,at most $10^5$ letters.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: For each test case if $S$ and $T$ are similar output `YES`, otherwise output `NO`.

statement.title: Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
3 AABBC ZZYYK AABBC ZZYY AABBC ZXYYKYES NO NO
